definition: to avoid/to shun/to flee/to escape/to keep away from/to leave/to hide from
actually/place/classifier for houses, small buildings, institutions etc/that which/particle introducing a relative clause or passive/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: She has a little retreat in the mountains.
sentences.chinese: 她在山中有一处小小的避难所。

sentences.english: They sought refuge in the mountain villages .
sentences.chinese: 他们到山村里寻找避难所。

sentences.english: Workers built shelters for survivors whose homes had been destroyed.
sentences.chinese: 救援人员为那些家园被毁的幸存者盖起了避难所。

sentences.english: God is our shelter in life's storms.
sentences.chinese: 上帝是十号风球时的避难所。

sentences.english: Those tsunami victims are in evacuation centers.
sentences.chinese: 海啸的受害者们现在都在避难所里。

sentences.english: Two villages in the county were severely damaged and villagers are living in shelters.
sentences.chinese: 该县两个村庄严重受损，村民们都已住进了避难所。

sentences.english: These activities are organized in shelters, congregated groups and homes in devastated communities.
sentences.chinese: 这些活动在受灾人群密集的避难所进行组织。

sentences.english: Comedy is the last refuge of the nonconformist mind.
sentences.chinese: 喜剧是不循规蹈矩者最后的避难所。

sentences.english: The total number of containing people accounts for 200.
sentences.chinese: 避难所可以容纳的总人数为200名。

sentences.english: The shelter is also home to a camel.
sentences.chinese: 这个避难所也是这只骆驼的家园。

sentences.english: In Findlay, Ohio, hundreds remain in a shelter.
sentences.chinese: 在俄亥俄州的芬德雷市，有数百人还留在避难所。

sentences.english: Mariam said she felt fortunate to have found refuge.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽亚表示她能来到避难所已经很幸运了。

sentences.english: In this respect, our research relates to the so-called Pollution Haven Hypothesis (PHH).
sentences.chinese: 就此而言，我们的研究主要和污染避难所假说有关。

sentences.english: God is in her citadels; he has shown himself to be her fortress.
sentences.chinese: 神在其宫中自显为避难所。

sentences.english: It soon became a refuge from the fame he increasingly eschewed.
sentences.chinese: 很快这里变成了他逐渐远离名利的避难所。

definition: stronghold/defended military base/base for operations/strategic point/foothold/(market) presence
